p: The history of influenza virus circulation is encompassed within the individual. In each person lies the timeline of past epidemics materialized as memory cell specificity. Since the immune responses of each new infection is dictated by individual preimmunity, we look to the past to predict the outcome of the next infection. Here we will briefly review the modern history (past ~150 years) of influenza virus circulation to understand the epidemiological and immunological outcomes of influenza virus infection and vaccination.
